title: Rounded Sans Italic with Perpetua-like g
content:
Hi folks,

This sample was sent to me for ID help, and I have run out of ideas. Identifying italics is a pain, because most sites make you examine the Roman samples first.

Anyone recognize this? Thanks for your help.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130407144803im_/http:/typophile.com/files/portfolios_5339.gif)
author: bowfinpw

comments.content:
Thanks Dan. The Perpetua-like g was not a coincidence then, as Eric Sans is based on Gill's work.

- Mike Yanega
